Body: Possible Duplicate:  Why are some Apps on the market be incompatible with my device?  I would like to download and install this app on my Samsung Continuum SCH-I400 running Android 2.2.2 but instead of a download button, the Market displays an error message that reads:  Your device isn't compatible with this item.I checked the minimum requirement for this app and it says Android 2.2. Why would Android Market flag it as incompatible with my phone?Is there a way to get from the Android Market more details about this incompatibility?What do I need to add or change in my Samsung Continuum SCH-I400 to make it compatible?
Title: "device isn't compatible with this item" - why?

history.Text: I would like to download and install [this app][1] on my Samsung Continuum SCH-I400 running Android 2.2.2 but install of a `download` button the Market displays an error message that reads:> Your device isn't compatible with this item.I checked the minimum requirement for this app and it says Android 2.2. Why would Android Market flag it as incompatible with my phone?Is there a way to get from the Android Market more details about this incompatibility?What do I need to add or change in my Samsung Continuum SCH-I400 to make it compatible?  [1]: https://market.android.com/details?id=com.softwarecandy.outsmartmike.googlefree&hl=en
"device isn't compatible with this item" - why?

I would like to download and install [this app][1] on my *Samsung Continuum SCH-I400* running Android **2.2.2** but instead of a `download` button, the Market displays an error message that reads:> Your device isn't compatible with this item.I checked the minimum requirement for this app and it says Android **2.2**. Why would Android Market flag it as incompatible with my phone?Is there a way to get from the Android Market more details about this incompatibility?What do I need to add or change in my *Samsung Continuum SCH-I400* to make it compatible?  [1]: https://market.android.com/details?id=com.softwarecandy.outsmartmike.googlefree&hl=en
